content: offering memory increments 2.5.1 Memory subsystem topology The IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ memory subsystem use high-speed, differential-ended communications memory channels to link a host memory to the main memory storage devices. The CPC drawer memory topology of an IBM z168 is shown in Figure 2-18. Figure 2-18 CPC drawer memory topology at maximum configuration Consider the following points regarding the topology: Memory increment (GB) Offered memory sizes (GB) 8 64 - 96 32 128 - 544 64 608 - 736 128 864 - 2144 256 2400 - 3936 512 4448 - 16224 8 Same memory topology is used in the IBM z16 A02 and IBM z16 AGZ. Chapter 2. Central processor complex hardware components 45  Six memory controllers per drawer, one per PU chip  Each memory controller supports 8 DIMM slots  Two, four, five or six memory controllers per drawer will be populated (16, 32, 40, 48 DIMMs)  Different memory controllers may have different size DIMMs  Features with different DIMMs sizes can be mixed in the same
